hÅjin UchÅ« KÅkÅ« KenkyÅ« Kaihatsu KikÅ|literally "Independent Administrative
Institution on Aerospace Research and Development "}}, or 'JAXA', is Japan's
national aerospace agency. Through the merger of three previously independent
organizations, JAXA was formed on 1 October 2003. JAXA is responsible for
research, technology development and the launch of satellites into orbit, and is
involved in many more advanced missions, such as asteroid exploration and
possible manned exploration of the Moon. Its motto is One
JAXA [http://www.jaxa.jp/article/interview/vol21/p2_e.html Keiji Tachikawa â
JAXA in 2006 ] and its corporate slogan is
Reaching for the skies, exploring
space. [http://www.jaxa.jp/about/index_e.html Jaxa | About Jaxa ]
